title._content: In March read the books you've always meant to read (LOC)

description._content: In March read the books you've always meant to read Chicago : Ill. Art Proj., [between 1936 and 1941] 1 print on board (poster) : silkscreen, color. Notes: Date stamped on verso: Mar 25 1941. Work Projects Administration Poster Collection (Library of Congress). Poster for statewide Library Project showing a windblown woman and books by authors such as Scott, Dumas, Thackeray, Dickens, Austen, and others. Subjects: Reading--Illinois--1930-1950. Books--1930-1950. Libraries--Illinois--1930-1950. Format: Posters--1930-1950. Screen prints--Color--1930-1950. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print More information about the WPA Posters is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.wpapos Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3f05175 Call Number: POS - WPA - ILL .01 .I5531, no. 1
